maml:description.maml:para: Converts the special characters in string.
Escapes special characters so they are not misinterpreted as wildcards or other special characters.
File path to convert.
File path to convert.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.

maml:alert.maml:para: Useful with Send-WinSCPItem, Receive-WinSCPItem, Remove-WinSCPItem cmdlets.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> ConvertTo-WinSCPEscapedString -FileMask 'FileWithA*InName.txt'
FileWithA[*]InName.txt

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -UserName 'ftpuser' -Password 'FtpUserPword' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> $fileName = ConvertTo-WinSCPEscapedString -FileMask 'FileWithA*InName.txt' PS C:\> Receive-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -RemoteItem "/rDir/$fileName" -LocalItem 'C:\lDir\'
Transfers Failures IsSuccess --------- -------- --------- {/rDir/FileWithA*InName.txt} {} True

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the contents of a remote directory.
Displays the contents within a remote directory, including other directories and files.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Specifies a path to one or more locations. Wildcards are permitted. The default location is the home directory of the user making the connection.
Filter to be applied to returned objects.
Return items from all subdirectories.
Return only directory objects.
Return only file objects.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Specifies a path to one or more locations. Wildcards are permitted. The default location is the home directory of the user making the connection.
Filter to be applied to returned objects.
Return items from all subdirectories.
Return only directory objects.
Return only file objects.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Provides methods for creating, manipulating, searching, and sorting arrays, thereby serving as the base class for all arrays in the common language runtime.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Get-WinSCPChildItem -Path '/rDir/'
Directory: /rDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 rSubDir - 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 rTextFile.txt

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' Get-WinSCPChildItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path '/rDir/' -Recurse
Directory: /rDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 rSubDir - 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 rTextFile.txt
Directory: /rDir/rSubDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- - 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 rSubDirTextFile.txt

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves information about a File or Directory from an active WinSCP Session.
Retrieves Name, FileType, Length, LastWriteTime, FilePermissions, and IsDirectory Properties on an Item from an Active WinSCP Session.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote Item.
Filters the returned results.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote Item.
Filters the returned results.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents data about remote file.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Get-WinSCPItem -Path '/rDir/rSubDir'
Directory: /rDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 /rdir/rSubDir

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Get-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path '/rDir/rSubDir'
Directory: /rDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 /rdir/rSubDir

maml:description.maml:para: Calculates a checksum of a remote file.
Use IANA Algorithm to retrieve the checksum of a remote file.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.

A name of a checksum algorithm to use. Use IANA name of algorithm or use a name of any proprietary algorithm the server supports (with SFTP protocol only). Commonly supported algorithms are sha-1 and md5.
A full path to a remote file to calculate a checksum for.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.

A name of a checksum algorithm to use. Use IANA name of algorithm or use a name of any proprietary algorithm the server supports (with SFTP protocol only). Commonly supported algorithms are sha-1 and md5.
A full path to a remote file to calculate a checksum for.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Provides methods for creating, manipulating, searching, and sorting arrays, thereby serving as the base class for all arrays in the common language runtime.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -Protocol Ftp | Get-WinSCPItemChecksum -Algorithm 'sha-1' -Path '/rDir/file.txt'

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes a command on an Active WinSCP Session.
Invokes a command on the system hosting the FTP/SFTP Service.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Command to execute.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Command to execute.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents results of Session.ExecuteCommand.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Invoke-WinSCPCommand -WinSCPSession $session -Command ("mysqldump --opt -u {0} --password={1} --all-databases | gzip > {2}" -f $dbUsername, $dbPassword, $tempFilePath)

maml:description.maml:para: Moves an item from one location to another from an active WinSCP Session.
Once connected to an active WinSCP Session, one or many files can be moved to another location within the same WinSCP Session.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote item to be moved.
Full path to new location to move the item to.
Creates the destination directory if it does not exist.
Returns a WinSCP.RemoteFileInfo of the moved object.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote item to be moved.
Full path to new location to move the item to.
Creates the destination directory if it does not exist.
Returns a WinSCP.RemoteFileInfo of the moved object.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Specifies a return value type for a method that does not return a value.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Move-WinSCPItem -Path '/rDir/rFile.txt' -Destination '/rDir/rSubDir/'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Move-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path '/rDir/rFile.txt' -Destination '/rDir/rSubDir/' -PassThru
Directory: /rdir/rSubdir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 rFile.txt

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a directory on an active WinSCP Session.
After creating a valid WinSCP Session, this function can be used to create new directory or nested directories.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote directory to create.
The name of the new item to be created. This can be omitted if full path is used to the new item.
The type of object to be created, IE: File, Directory.
Initial value to add to the object being created.
Will overwrite and existing item of the same name.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote directory to create.
The name of the new item to be created. This can be omitted if full path is used to the new item.
The type of object to be created, IE: File, Directory.
Initial value to add to the object being created.
Will overwrite and existing item of the same name.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents data about remote file.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | New-WinSCPItem-Path '/rDir/rSubDir' -ItemType Directory
Directory: /rDir/
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 /rSubDir

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> New-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path './rDir' -Name 'rTextFile.txt' -ItemType File -Value 'Hello World!'
Directory: /rDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- - 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 12 /rTextFile.txt

maml:description.maml:para: Represents *nix-style remote file permissions.
Creates a new WinSCP.FilePermmissions object that can be used with Send-WinSCPItem to apply permissions.
Execute permission for group.
Read permission for group.
Read permission for group.
Permissions as a number.
Permissions in octal format, e.g. "644". Octal format has 3 or 4 (when any special permissions are set) digits.
Execute permission for others.
Read permission for others.
Write permission for others.
Grants the user, who executes the file, permissions of file group.
Grants the user, who executes the file, permissions of file owner.
Sticky bit.
Permissions as a text in format "rwxrwxrwx".
Execute permission for owner.
Read permission for owner.
Write permission for owner.
Execute permission for group.
Read permission for group.
Read permission for group.
Permissions as a number.
Permissions in octal format, e.g. "644". Octal format has 3 or 4 (when any special permissions are set) digits.
Execute permission for others.
Read permission for others.
Write permission for others.
Grants the user, who executes the file, permissions of file group.
Grants the user, who executes the file, permissions of file owner.
Sticky bit.
Permissions as a text in format "rwxrwxrwx".
Execute permission for owner.
Read permission for owner.
Write permission for owner.
Represents *nix-style remote file permissions.

maml:alert.maml:para: Can only be used with File Uploads.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPItemPermission
Numeric : 0 Text : --------- Octal : 000 OtherExecute : False OtherWrite : False OtherRead : False GroupExecute : False GroupWrite : False GroupRead : False UserExecute : False UserWrite : False UserRead : False Sticky : False SetGid : False SetUid : False

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPItemPermission -GroupExecute -GroupRead -UserExecute -UserRead
Numeric : 360 Text : r-xr-x--- Octal : 550 OtherExecute : False OtherWrite : False OtherRead : False GroupExecute : True GroupWrite : False GroupRead : True UserExecute : True UserWrite : False UserRead : True Sticky : False SetGid : False SetUid : False

maml:description.maml:para: Defines information to allow an automatic connection and authentication of the session.
Defines all settings that can be configured for the WinSCP.SessionOptions Object, then opens and returns the WinSCP.Session Object.
PSCredential object used for authentication.
Possible values are FtpMode.Passive (default) and FtpMode.Active.
FTPS mode. Possible values are FtpSecure.None (default), FtpSecure.Implicit and FtpSecure.Explicit (FtpSecure.ExplicitTls in older versions).

Give up security and accept any SSH host key. To be used in exceptional situations only, when security is not required. When set, log files will include warning about insecure connection. To maintain security, use SshHostKeyFingerprint.

Give up security and accept any FTPS/WebDAVS server TLS/SSL certificate. To be used in exceptional situations only, when security is not required. When set, log files will include warning about insecure connection. To maintain security, use TlsHostCertificateFingerprint.
Name of the host to connect to. Mandatory property.
Port number to connect to. Keep default 0 to use the default port for the protocol.
Protocol to use for the session. Possible values are Protocol.Sftp (default), Protocol.Scp, Protocol.Ftp and Protocol.Webdav.
Fingerprint of SSH server host key (or several alternative fingerprints separated by semicolon). It makes WinSCP automatically accept host key with the fingerprint. Mandatory for SFTP/SCP protocol.
Full path to private key file.
Passphrase for encrypted private keys.
Fingerprint of FTPS/WebDAVS server TLS/SSL certificate to be automatically accepted (useful for certificates signed by untrusted authority).
Server response timeout. Defaults to 15 seconds.
Use WebDAVS (WebDAV over TLS/SSL), instead of WebDAV.
WebDAV root path.
A Hashtable of Settings and Values to add to the WinSCP.SessionOptions Object.
Path to store assembly debug log to. Default null means, no debug log file is created. See also SessionLogPath. The property has to be set before calling Open.
Path to store session log file to. Default null means, no session log file is created.
Sets time limit in seconds to try reconnecting broken sessions. Default is 120 seconds. Use TimeSpan.MaxValue to remove any limit.
Adds the ability to run a script block for each file transfer.
PSCredential object used for authentication.
Possible values are FtpMode.Passive (default) and FtpMode.Active.
FTPS mode. Possible values are FtpSecure.None (default), FtpSecure.Implicit and FtpSecure.Explicit (FtpSecure.ExplicitTls in older versions).

Give up security and accept any SSH host key. To be used in exceptional situations only, when security is not required. When set, log files will include warning about insecure connection. To maintain security, use SshHostKeyFingerprint.

Give up security and accept any FTPS/WebDAVS server TLS/SSL certificate. To be used in exceptional situations only, when security is not required. When set, log files will include warning about insecure connection. To maintain security, use TlsHostCertificateFingerprint.
Name of the host to connect to. Mandatory property.
Port number to connect to. Keep default 0 to use the default port for the protocol.
Protocol to use for the session. Possible values are Protocol.Sftp (default), Protocol.Scp, Protocol.Ftp and Protocol.Webdav.
Fingerprint of SSH server host key (or several alternative fingerprints separated by semicolon). It makes WinSCP automatically accept host key with the fingerprint. Mandatory for SFTP/SCP protocol.
Full path to private key file.
Passphrase for encrypted private keys.
Fingerprint of FTPS/WebDAVS server TLS/SSL certificate to be automatically accepted (useful for certificates signed by untrusted authority).
Server response timeout. Defaults to 15 seconds.
Use WebDAVS (WebDAV over TLS/SSL), instead of WebDAV.
WebDAV root path.
A Hashtable of Settings and Values to add to the WinSCP.SessionOptions Object.
Path to store assembly debug log to. Default null means, no debug log file is created. See also SessionLogPath. The property has to be set before calling Open.
Path to store session log file to. Default null means, no session log file is created.
Sets time limit in seconds to try reconnecting broken sessions. Default is 120 seconds. Use TimeSpan.MaxValue to remove any limit.
Adds the ability to run a script block for each file transfer.
Represents a set of security credentials, such as a user name and a password.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function is used to open a WinSCP Session to be used with most other cmdlets in the WinSCP PowerShell Module.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -Protocol Ftp
ExecutablePath : AdditionalExecutableArguments : DefaultConfiguration : True DisableVersionCheck : False IniFilePath : ReconnectTime : 00:02:00 ReconnectTimeInMilliseconds : 120000 DebugLogPath : DebugLogLevel : 0 SessionLogPath : XmlLogPath : C:\Users\$env:USERNAME\AppData\Local\Temp\wscp6934.0246B60F.tmp HomePath : / Timeout : 00:01:00 Output : {winscp> option batch on, batch on , reconnecttime 120 , winscp> option confirm off...} Opened : True UnderlyingSystemType : WinSCP.Session

maml:description.maml:para: Sets options for file transfers.
Sets available options for file transfers between the client and server.
http://winscp.net/eng/docs/file_mask
Permissions to applied to a remote file (used for uploads only).
Preserve timestamp (set last write time of destination file to that of source file). Defaults to true.

Sets what files will be transferred with resume support/to temporary filename. Use TransferResumeSupportState.Default for built-in default (currently all files above 100 KB), TransferResumeSupportState.On for all files, TransferResumeSupportState.Off for no file (turn off) or TransferResumeSupportState.Smart for all files above threshold (see Threshold).
Threshold (in KB) for State.Smart mode.
Limit transfer speed (in KB/s).
Possible values are TransferMode.Binary (default), TransferMode.Ascii and TransferMode.Automatic (based on file extension).
http://winscp.net/eng/docs/file_mask
Permissions to applied to a remote file (used for uploads only).
Preserve timestamp (set last write time of destination file to that of source file). Defaults to true.

Sets what files will be transferred with resume support/to temporary filename. Use TransferResumeSupportState.Default for built-in default (currently all files above 100 KB), TransferResumeSupportState.On for all files, TransferResumeSupportState.Off for no file (turn off) or TransferResumeSupportState.Smart for all files above threshold (see Threshold).
Threshold (in KB) for State.Smart mode.
Limit transfer speed (in KB/s).
Possible values are TransferMode.Binary (default), TransferMode.Ascii and TransferMode.Automatic (based on file extension).
Defines options for file transfers.

maml:alert.maml:para: New-WinSCPTransferOption is equivalent to New-Object -TypeName WinSCP.TransferOptions.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPTransferOption -PreserveTimeStamp:$false -TransferMode Binary
PreserveTimestamp : False FilePermissions : TransferMode : Binary FileMask : ResumeSupport : default SpeedLimit : 0

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPTransferOption -FilePermissions (New-WinSCPItemPermission -GroupExecute -OtherRead)
PreserveTimestamp : True FilePermissions : -----xr-- TransferMode : Binary FileMask : ResumeSupport : default SpeedLimit : 0

maml:description.maml:para: Receives file(s) from an active WinSCP Session.
After creating a valid WinSCP Session, this function can be used to receive file(s) and remove the remote files if desired.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.

Full path to remote directory followed by slash and wildcard to select files or subdirectories to download. When wildcard is omitted (path ends with slash), all files and subdirectories in the remote directory are downloaded.
Full path to download the file to. When downloading multiple files, the filename in the path should be replaced with operation mask or omitted (path ends with slash).
When present, deletes source file(s) after transfer.
Defines options for file transfers.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.

Full path to remote directory followed by slash and wildcard to select files or subdirectories to download. When wildcard is omitted (path ends with slash), all files and subdirectories in the remote directory are downloaded.
Full path to download the file to. When downloading multiple files, the filename in the path should be replaced with operation mask or omitted (path ends with slash).
When present, deletes source file(s) after transfer.
Defines options for file transfers.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents results of transfer operation.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Receive-WinSCPItem -Path '/rDir/rFile.txt' -Destination 'C:\lDir\lFile.txt'
Transfers Failures IsSuccess --------- -------- --------- {/rDir/rFile.txt} {} True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Receive-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path '/rDir/rFile.txt' -Destination 'C:\lDir\lFile.txt' -Remove
Transfers Failures IsSuccess --------- -------- --------- {/rDir/rFile.txt} {} True

maml:description.maml:para: Removes and item from an active WinSCP Session.
Removes and item, File or Directory from a remote sources. This action will recurse if a the $Path value is a directory.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote directory followed by slash and wildcard to select files or subdirectories to remove.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote directory followed by slash and wildcard to select files or subdirectories to remove.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Specifies a return value type for a method that does not return a value.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Remove-WinSCPItem -Path "/rDir/rFile.txt"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Remove-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path "/rDir/rFile.txt"

maml:description.maml:para: Closes and disposes an active WinSCP Session Object.
After a WinSCP Session is no longer needed this function will dispose the COM object.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Specifies a return value type for a method that does not return a value.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -UserName 'ftpuser' -Password 'FtpUserPword' -Protocol Ftp | Remove-WinSCPSession

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -Username 'ftpuser' -Password 'FtpUserPword' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Remove-WinSCPSession -WinSCPSession $session

maml:description.maml:para: Renames a remote item
Renames a remote file or directory. Be sure to include the file extension when renameing a file.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote item to be renamed.
The new name for the the item.
Will return a WinSCP.RemoteFileInfo object representation of the renamed object if used.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote item to be renamed.
The new name for the the item.
Will return a WinSCP.RemoteFileInfo object representation of the renamed object if used.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Specifies a return value type for a method that does not return a value.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Rename-WinSCPItem -Path '/rDir/rFile.txt' -NewName 'rNewFile.txt'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Rename-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path '/rDir/rFile.txt' -Destination 'rNewFile.txt' -PassThru
Directory: /rDir
FileType LastWriteTime Length Name -------- ------------- ------ ---- D 1/1/2015 12:00:00 AM 0 /rNewFile.txt

maml:description.maml:para: Send file(s) to an active WinSCP Session.
After creating a valid WinSCP Session, this function can be used to send file(s).
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.

Full path to local file or directory to upload. Filename in the path can be replaced with Windows wildcard to select multiple files. When file name is omitted (path ends with backslash), all files and subdirectories in the local directory are uploaded.
Full path to upload the file to. When uploading multiple files, the filename in the path should be replaced with ConvertTo-WinSCPEscapedString or omitted (path ends with slash).
When present, deletes source file(s) after transfer.
Transfer options. Defaults to null, what is equivalent to New-TransferOptions.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.

Full path to local file or directory to upload. Filename in the path can be replaced with Windows wildcard to select multiple files. When file name is omitted (path ends with backslash), all files and subdirectories in the local directory are uploaded.
Full path to upload the file to. When uploading multiple files, the filename in the path should be replaced with ConvertTo-WinSCPEscapedString or omitted (path ends with slash).
When present, deletes source file(s) after transfer.
Transfer options. Defaults to null, what is equivalent to New-TransferOptions.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents results of transfer operation.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Send-WinSCPItem -Path 'C:\lDir\lFile.txt' -Destination '/rDir/rFile.txt'
Transfers Failures IsSuccess --------- -------- --------- {C:\lDir\lFile.txt} {} True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Send-WinSCPItem -WinSCPSession $session -Path 'C:\lDir\lFile.txt' -Destination '/rDir/rFile.txt' -Remove
Transfers Failures IsSuccess --------- -------- --------- {C:\lDir\lFile.txt} {} True

maml:description.maml:para: Opens a new instance of the WinSCP CLI.
Opens a new instance of the WinSCP Command Line Interface where raw commands can be executed.
Specifies a return value type for a method that does not return a value.
Specifies a return value type for a method that does not return a value.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Start-WinSCPConsole

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronizes directories with an active WinSCP Session.
Synchronizes a local directory with a remote directory, or vise versa.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Synchronization mode. Possible values are Local, Remote and Both.
Full path to local directory.
Full path to remote directory.
When used, deletes obsolete files. Cannot be used with -Mode Both.
When used, synchronizes in mirror mode (synchronizes also older files). Cannot be used for -Mode Both.
Comparison criteria. Possible values are None, Time (default), .Size and Either. For -Mode Both Time can be used only.
Transfer options. Defaults to null, what is equivalent to New-WinSCPTransferOptions.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Synchronization mode. Possible values are Local, Remote and Both.
Full path to local directory.
Full path to remote directory.
When used, deletes obsolete files. Cannot be used with -Mode Both.
When used, synchronizes in mirror mode (synchronizes also older files). Cannot be used for -Mode Both.
Comparison criteria. Possible values are None, Time (default), .Size and Either. For -Mode Both Time can be used only.
Transfer options. Defaults to null, what is equivalent to New-WinSCPTransferOptions.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents results of synchronization.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

-------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Test if a remote item exists.
After creating a valid WinSCP Session, this function can be used to test if a directory or file exists on the remote source.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote file.
A valid open WinSCP.Session, returned from New-WinSCPSession.
Full path to remote file.
It represents a session and provides methods for manipulating remote files over SFTP, SCP or FTP session.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents a Boolean (true or false) value.

maml:alert.maml:para: If the WinSCPSession is piped into this command, the connection will be closed and the object will be disposed upon completion of the command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-WinSCPSession -Credential (New-Object -TypeName System.Managemnet.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $env:USERNAME, (New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString)) -HostName $env:COMPUTERNAME -Protocol Ftp | Test-WinSCPPath -Path '/rDir/rSubDir'
True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential PS C:\> $session = New-WinSCPSession -Credential $credential -Hostname 'myftphost.org' -SshHostKeyFingerprint 'ssh-rsa 1024 xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx' PS C:\> Test-WinSCPPath -WinSCPSession $session -Path '/rDir/rSubDir'
True
